discourse_list.title: Bloomberg: SEC Investigating UST Stablecoin Blowup in Fresh Threat to Terra

content.content: Not surprisingly, Bloomberg is reporting that the SEC is investigating whether the marketing of TerraUSD before it crashed last month violated federal investor-protection regulations. https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-06-09/sec-investigating-ust-stablecoin-blowup-in-fresh-threat-to-terra#xj4y7vzkg In another blow to Kwon, this week the 2nd Circuit Court of Appeals affirmed the federal district court order requiring compliance with investigative subpoenas served by the SEC on TFL and Do Kwon.  See Terraform Labs Pte Ltd. and Do Kwon (Release No. LR-25415; Jun. 9, 2022) In astonishing fashion, notwithstanding the impending doom, it seems people are still investing in Kwon’s product.
This will perhaps affect several stablecoins, perhaps not directly DAI, but some backers that DAI has.
Yes, I think it will impact the industry overall. The rest of the space needs to learn from this and plan accordingly.
And if they had to pay any fine they would probably pay it by selling a big part of the new Luna they launched, so to the floor again the investors’ money, pitiful.
It will certainly have an impact. An SEC sanction is to be feared, remember the Lbry and Ripple cases.

Last year, the SEC also began an investigation into Circle, the issuer of USDC, our highest % is in USDC, if everything is correct we should not worry, but we must be aware of everything they report.    coindesk.com – 5 Oct 21    SEC Subpoenas USDC Stablecoin Backer Circle Circle said it is “fully cooperating” with the investigation but has declined to elaborate on its scope.      Based on the whales we can see how various amounts have moved from Tether to USDC, so this could be good news for DAI.  FU548J0WYAI8kBs800×473 28.2 KB  Not counting the many conventional companies that accept USDC as a payment method such as MoneyGram👈 and partnering with Stellar🪐 for this function, including AirTM as well. As long as USDC is on the right side, DAI will have a much easier path.

Moi:  Last year, the SEC also began an investigation into Circle, the issuer of USDC, our highest % is in USDC, if everything is correct we should not worry, but we must be aware of everything they report.   Agreed. 100%. I am all about trying to be proactive instead of reactive.

Right, there is a significant trend change, hopefully the research will be positive towards USDC in the stablecoin environment, because in general we have already seen that Terra has negatively affected the popularity of all the other stablecoins.
I mean SEC also chased Do for Mirror Finance but didn’t pursue further so we will see this time
I think USDC will be safe. The risk is that Dai itself gets caught up in whatever definition of algorithmic stablecoins lawmakers choose to use.
Yes but what has transpired recently is so headline grabbing and so much was lost, I think we know where this is going.

Yes. I think the recent proposed bill will impact that and Toomey’s bill, assuming it goes anywhere, is really focused on stablecoins. He isn’t running again and I suppose his legislation could stall but l suspect it won’t even if someone else drafts something new.
